sect1.title: Cycles
sect1.para: Common development cycle patterns in free software.

sect2.title: Version Numbering
sect2.para: talk about how to do release numbers right

sect1.title: Integrating Process With Tools
sect1.para: How to tie in with the revision control system and the bug tracker, so that they become integral parts of distributed development.

sect1.title: Testing, Automated and Otherwise
sect1.para: Regression testing: choosing the right level of formality. Coordinating results from human volunteers.

sect1.title: Stabilizing and Releasing
sect1.para: Stabilization and release preparation (i.e., avoiding the last minute feature rush); making sure the process terminates in a finite amount of time. Point out how that releases may actually be harder in open source projects than in proprietary ones.

sect1.title: Maintaining Multiple Release Lines
sect1.para: Whether and how to maintain multiple release lines. Make sure this gets tied in bidirectionally with revision control discussion (branches, arch vs cvs-style, for example). Also, stress importance of training people to use the issue tracker well. Be patient, be verbose, repeat yourself -- it will feel stupid, but it will pay off.
